## PHQ-9 vs RAPI

PHQ-9 vs RAPI Comparing behavioural and psychological scales such as ***PHQ-9 vs RAPI*** is a vital part of research and evaluation in psychology and social sciences. However, such comparisons can often be a challenging and time-consuming process. This is where Harmony comes into play. This revolutionary software utilizes natural language processing and generative AI models to simplify and accelerate these comparisons. Harmony is particularly useful when comparing instruments like ***PHQ-9 vs RAPI***. The Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) is a recognized tool for assessing depression, while the Rutgers Alcohol Problem Index (RAPI) evaluates alcohol-related issues. Whether you are investigating the overlaps, identifying relationships or simply comparing measures, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item in these two instruments, immensely facilitating the cross-study comparison process. We encourage psychologists, researchers, and social scientists to utilise Harmony in their work with instruments such as ***PHQ-9 vs RAPI***. It allows users to select pre-loaded instruments from the software's database or upload their own questionnaire items in various formats, including PDF. Moreover, Harmony can handle comparisons across multiple languages, widening its scope and utility in international research. Visit Harmony's web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app to explore its powerful features.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and RAPI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and RAPI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RAPI into Harmony</a> - compare RAPI with other instruments
